author: Deleted User
content: We are heading into November and the deposit contract has not even launched yet.

author: Deleted User
content:
What could mitigate some damage/concerns is if they could at least communicate the date the contract goes live and stick to it this time. It's not needed to have a sneak drop of the contract in the same day, just let us know "Ok if no further errors in the audit then the Deposit contract goes live 5 Nov". 
That's all we ask.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm pretty strongly against software engineers providing *any* public date estimates.  I don't think I have *ever* seen it go well with the exception of when the software is already done and the launch date is intentionally delayed to sometime after that for marketing reasons.

author: Deleted User
content: I won't say anymore on the topic after this period, but there is increasing concern that ETH 2 will not launch in 2020. And the fallout and damage to Ethereum's reputation will be significant. The entire mood has changed from excitement to skepticism and caution. All the rhetoric right up until last week was that this was **‘imminent’**.......except for the BLS signatures thing at the last minute which was the same excuse last year... I understand I'm venting but **everyone** is frustrated. There, I've said my piece.

author: philcares
content:
> I won't say anymore on the topic after this period, but there is increasing concern that ETH 2 will not launch in 2020. And the fallout and damage to Ethereum's reputation will be significant. The entire mood has changed from excitement to skepticism and caution. All the rhetoric right up until last week was that this was **‘imminent’**.......except for the BLS signatures thing at the last minute which was the same excuse last year... I understand I'm venting but **everyone** is frustrated. There, I've said my piece.
<@456226577798135808> Please speak for yourself, not for me or others. **Everyone** is not frustrated. You are!

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**vbuterin**
I do think there's a substantial number of people who are frustrated, and the community has had to go through a lot with all the various delays. We're definitely trying our best to get the final steps done in a way that's both fast and safe

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**vbuterin**
One of the holdups on the deposit contract is just doing more to make sure that the UI infrastructure favors safe depositing; in the ethereum sale there were some cases of people who lost their keys and were naturally very upset as a result; minimizing risks like that is important as well

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**vbuterin**
I think another thing worth keeping in mind is that work on phase 1, eth2 client hardening, and all other things that otherwise would have waited after launch are still proceeding full speed ahead

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**vbuterin**
Also delays in the deposit contract don't necessarily imply delays in beacon chain launch

author: superphiz
content: Fyi- i shared this is the /r/ethfinance daily, users there feel starved for information and were very appreciative of this update.

author: djrtwo
content:
> .except for the BLS signatures thing at the last minute which was the same excuse last year
It seems I was not clear when I discussed this last week. `blst` is a library that is under audit. That was what I mentioned was a blocker last week.
BLS standardization has been underway for almost a year and a half and has provided us with various issues along the way but is not one today

author: huntingisland
content: He speaks for a huge percentage of the community
